newsitem.title: USA: EMI-Capitol to distribute new Prince album.
newsitem.headline: EMI-Capitol to distribute new Prince album.

text.p: Rock musician Prince's New Power Generation Records has teamed up with EMI to manufacture and distribute his three-disc album "Emancipation."
It will be released simultanously worldwide on November 19, it was announced this week.
Prince recorded the material during the period when he was trying to extricate himself from his recording pact with Warner Bros.

His disc, "Chaos & Disorder", which came out last year to mostly lukewarm reaction, was expected to be the last for the label. During promotional videos and performances for "Chaos & Disorder", Prince emblazoned "slave" on his face to communicate his dissatisfaction with the new team at Warner Bros.
"Freedom is a beautiful thing," Prince said in a statement. "I've been looking forward to this day for some time. Emancipation is the album I was born to make."
The chairman and CEO of EMI-Capitol Music Group, Charles Koppelman, called Prince "a groundbreaker, a risk-taker, a genius."
He added: "People in the industry overuse the word artist, but he is one in every sense of the word. This is a moment in time that will last forever."
EMI will hold a news conference next month to release details of the new album.
